title.value: Score-based Diffusion Models in Function Space
title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Score-based Diffusion Models in Function Space

extractions.description: This paper introduces Denoising Diffusion Operators (DDOs), a framework for training diffusion models in function space. The approach involves a forward process that perturbs input functions gradually using a Gaussian process and a reverse process formulated by integrating a function-valued Langevin dynamic. The study addresses technical challenges in generalizing denoising score matching to infinite-dimensional function spaces and demonstrates the approach's applicability on various function-valued problems, including solutions to the Navier-Stokes equation, volcano InSAR, and MNIST-SDF datasets.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to validate its approaches on various datasets and demonstrates the performance of its proposed methods.
type.quote: We theoretically and numerically verify the applicability of our approach on a set of function-valued problems, including generating solutions to the Navier-Stokes equation viewed as the push-forward distribution of forcings from a Gaussian Random Field (GRF), as well as volcano InSAR and MNIST-SDF.

name.justification: The paper primarily discusses advances in generative models using diffusion processes, specifically in the context of function spaces.
name.quote: Diffusion models have recently emerged as a powerful framework for generative modeling.

name.justification: The study focuses on modeling data in infinite-dimensional function spaces, as highlighted throughout the text.
name.quote: We show that the corresponding discretized algorithm generates accurate samples at a fixed cost independent of the data resolution.

name.justification: The paper leverages machine learning techniques, specifically neural operators, in its proposed framework.
name.quote: For learning the score, we utilize the neural operators (Li et al., 2020b,a; Kovachki et al., 2021b), which provide a consistent architecture in function space.

name.justification: The study proposes and explains the DDO model as an essential contribution to training diffusion models in function space.
name.quote: In our approach, we introduce a rigorous framework termed denoising diffusion operators (DDOs) that addresses these challenges.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced and contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: In our approach, we introduce a rigorous framework termed denoising diffusion operators (DDOs) that addresses these challenges.

is_executed.justification: The empirical results involve executing the model on function-valued datasets using computational resources.
is_executed.quote: We empirically show DDO learns distributions of function-valued data on various datasets, including generating solutions to the Navier-Stokes equation...

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the DDO model numerically against several baselines and shows its efficacy.
is_compared.quote: We empirically verify DDOâ€™s invariance to spatial discretization with fixed model capacity...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The DDO model is proposed in this paper, hence there is no prior reference.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We propose a diffusion model for incrementally sampling from the data distribution by discretizing an infinite-dimensional Langevin equation with a hierarchy of noise corruption Gaussian processes.

name.justification: The dataset pertains to solving the Navier-Stokes equation in function space, as utilized in this paper.
name.quote: We theoretically and numerically verify the applicability of our approach on a set of function-valued problems, including generating solutions to the Navier-Stokes equation viewed as the push-forward distribution of forcings from a Gaussian Random Field (GRF).

referenced_paper_title.quote: ...including generating solutions to the Navier-Stokes equation viewed as the push-forward distribution of forcings from a Gaussian Random Field (GRF).

name.justification: The dataset comprises observations for synthetic-aperture radar interferometry related to volcanoes used for the empirical validation of the proposed model.
name.quote: We empirically show DDO learns distributions of function-valued data on various datasets, including... volcano Interferometric Synthetic Aperture Radar (InSAR) (Rosen et al., 2012).
